data.title: Alcatraz Cruises (Official Provider)
data.meta_description: Experience the beauty, history and infamy of Alcatraz Island on San Francisco Bay. You will be astounded by what you see and learn.
data.text:
Alcatraz City Cruises

The official website and only source for tour tickets to Alcatraz Island

Is Alcatraz sold out for your date? Instead, Join us for the Bay Discovery Cruise!

Join us for the Bay Discovery Cruise! An enchanting sightseeing adventure on the stunning San Francisco Bay! This 90-minute voyage promises an experience filled with iconic San Francisco landmarks.

Experience The Night Tour

Experience the many moods of Alcatraz Island with an evening visit. Enjoy the beauty of a sunset silhouetting the Golden Gate Bridge, experience a cell door demonstration, and hear compelling stories about the Islandâs history and residents.

Discover The Cellhouse On An Alcatraz Day Tour

Enjoy access to Alcatraz Island, including the historic Alcatraz Cellhouse with the self-guided Cellhouse Audio Tour.

Explore The Island Behind The Scenes

Discover areas not otherwise available to the public!Â Join a group of 30 people or fewer on a guided 1.5-2 hour adventure to explore off-limits areas and hear little-known-stories about the Island’s fascinating past, then join the Alcatraz Night Tour (including Cellhouse Audio Tour) for a full evening’s experience.

Discover a Hidden Gem in San Francisco Bay: A Captivating Angel Island Tour

Exhibit: Red Power on Alcatraz, Perspectives 50 Years Later

In 1969, a group of Native American activists called the Indians of All Tribes arrived on Alcatraz Island. They spoke out against the United States governmentâs termination policy and the

Alcatraz History

1934 – 1963

Alcatraz and history go hand in hand

Once home to some of Americaâs most notorious criminals, the federal penitentiary that operated here from 1934 to 1963 brought a dark mystique to âThe Rockâ. The presence of infamous inmates, like Al âScarfaceâ Capone and the âBirdmanâ Robert Stroud, helped to establish the Islandâs notoriety. Yet, many people are unaware of the historical significance before and after it was one of the worldâs most legendary prisons.

1969 – 1971

The 20th Century

Civil War-era buildings, cannons, and subterranean rooms give insight into the 19th century when the Island served as both a harbor defense fort and a military prison. As you dock at Alcatraz Island, visible reminders of the American Indian Occupation, which began in 1969 and ended in 1971, remains etched on âThe Rockâ, recognizing an important milestone in the American Indian rights movement.
